dialogues.text: Forget it. Just then, HOLLY appears from down a hallway. March doesn't see her. Neither does Healy. March follows Healy, reaches for his shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Wait, wait. Just one Goddamn secon-- Healy SHOVES HIM. March stumbles, knocking trash and beer bottles off the coffee table. Lands on his ass... Sits in spilled beer, pitiful.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: I'll find these guys myself. I don't need a pathetic idiot.  74

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Oh, you don't need a pathetic idiot. Ahhh, see, I had it confused -- March glances over at that exact second. LOCKS EYES with daughter. The look on her face stops him cold: She's ashamed of him. Healy on his way out the door, says:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: You're the world's worst detective.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: .».. Yeah, but I got a really cool ad. Then, just before Healy's gone, March makes a decision --

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Hey, Healy -- say 'Hi' to Amelia for me.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: ‘Course, you won't have much luck at the airport... Seeing as it's not a flight. Healy hesitates, turns back... March shrugs:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Your note. It's not a flight. Look at it. Healy looks at it: 28-10 BURBANK APT. WEST, FLT 2, 10:30 March gets to his feet... Speaks unerringly from memory:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Most airports -- Burbank included -- have nighttime overflight curfews. 10 to 6. Plus that first number? It's today's date, reversed the European way -- which makes sense when you see FLT. That's not flight. My guess? It's flat. As in apartment. Pause. Healy stands, thunderstruck. Licks his lips, think

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: And Burbank APT. West..?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: The Burbank Apartments West. I've driven past it a few times. It's a dump.  75 He gets up. Sighs. Turns to Holly:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: We're going now. And you're going to Jessica's. For real this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Healy slews his car to a stop along a deserted-looking bl on Vineland... Healy and March clamber out. Look around. Only there's nothing here. A gas station. An empty lot. AN ELDERLY MAN is out walking his dog. Healy hails him:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: ‘Evening. We're, uh, looking for the Burbank Apartments..?

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: (points to empty lot) Used to be there. Tore those puppies down, going on two years now. He walks on. Leaves March and Healy just standing there. A pause. Another pause. Then March turns to Healy and say

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: So. The airport, then..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above us, a BOEING 737 climbs skyward. Wingtips blinking

dialogues.speaker: CAR BLOW-BY
dialogues.text: Healy and March rocket past, doing eighty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Healy at the wheel. Speeding. Racing against time.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Well, they used to have those overflight restrictions. I read all about ‘em. So, okay, maybe they changed them, but if they did then that's... that's just wrong. Healy is just ignoring him. Fuming. March decides it's be to drop it. Stares out the side window. Squints, then:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Hey, she's not going to the airport.  76

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: What. .? March points out the window.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Pull over. Healy glances over:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Look, I've had it to here with your -- (stops) What? What are you pointing at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car glides to the curb, and the two men stare silentl at this vision before them... Healy whistles: A FIFTEEN-STORY GLASS AND STEEL TOWER. Rising up from an expanse of asphalt. On a huge MARQUEE:

dialogues.speaker: BURBANK AIRPORT WESTIN
dialogues.text: And underneath: Visit "THE FLIGHT LOUNGE" Disco 1 & 2 Healy just shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: West is Westin. She's not leaving town.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: (nods ) She's meeting someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCH AND HEALY hurry through the faux-maritime Mecca tha is the AIRPORT WESTIN. Locate the FLIGHT LOUNGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the moment, no one but the bartender, JOE. Our guys belly up to the bar --

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: "Evening. What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Information. Ever see this girl? He props a snapshot of AMELIA on the bar. Joe frowns:  77

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Looks familiar. You guys cops?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: In spirit. She woulda come in, like, last half hour..?

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Hey. I just work here.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: I know, dickhead, that's why I'm asking. Maybe ordered something wacky, say, a bourbon martini..? Bingo. We see the spark of recognition:

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Riiiight... Could be. Memory gets foggy, you know? What's in it for me?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: (indicates Healy) He'll stop doing it.

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Doing what? Healy grabs Joe's TIE, yanks--! Bounces his head off the

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: That.

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: OW! Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Listen -- Joe, is it? (reading nametag) We really need to find her.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Yeah. And Joe, we can do this the easy way, or-- oh, wait, this is the easy way. Healy reaches for Joe again --

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Okay! Jesus. What ever happened to offering me twenty bucks?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: We're in a recession. The girl?  Healy and Healy and Red flag. 78

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: The PENTHOUSE. Top floor. (massages his forehead) She's in the penthouse. There. You happy?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: She's there now.

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Sure, yeah, but listen -- you guys don't wanna go up there, trust me.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Why? Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: These New York guys. Business guys, whatever -- point is, they got fucking bodyguards. Mohammed types -- you know the kind, had their balls removed. What's that called?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Marriage.

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Anyway, he booked the penthouse. March exchange glances:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: What the hell is she up to..?

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: (pleading) Guys, no one wants trouble. She's gotta come back down. Can't you just... hang here, have a couple cold ones on me? March mull it over. Why not?

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: There. See? Very reasonable. Your buddy, that was the problem, he wasn't reasonable -- HEALY picks up on it instantly:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Say again. Our buddy..?

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: The other guy, yeah, come round lookin' for Amelia -- he wasn't with you?  719

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Describe him. He have a name?

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: No name. Big fucker. Blonde. Like a Nebraska boy, corn-fed, you know?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Where'd he go?

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Got on the elevator. Right before you came in.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: You witnessed this.

dialogues.speaker: JOE THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: No, it was told to me by a wise old Indian, of course I fucking witnessed it. (stands) I'll grab you a couple beers. He exits. HEALY chews on that. Says without looking up:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Could be... Makes sense... John Boy.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Who. .?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Some guy Blue Face mentioned.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Mentioned? Mentioned how?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: You know: "This man is coming to kill you..." That kinda crap.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Big, farm-looking motherfucker. .? (beat, shakes his head) Shit, what am I talking about..? We don't even know what John Boy looks like. March is starting to look panicked.  80

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Look, all we gotta do is wait, right..? She comes down, we grab her, ta-da.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: I suppose. Unless he's up there now, murdering her. They both sit there, pointedly not looking at each other.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Not worth getting shot over.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: You wouldn't think. He rubs tired eyes. Lets out a long, ragged breath.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Okay. Here we go. March's face registers the sort of undistilled misery onl true coward can appreciate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Healy and March step inside the elevator. March presses "P". They ascend. It's a glass elevator, you can see the city outside. They stare at the elevator doors. They've seen the city. New Age MUZAK, serene. All of life's rough edges, blunted

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: (abruptly) Munich.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: That's it, right? What you call a guy, had his nuts removed? A Munich? Healy slips on his brass knuckles. Flexes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Munich is a city in Germany.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Oh. (brightens) Hitler only had one ball.  81

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd heard that. (watching the floor indicator) Okay, here we go. They face forward. Shoulders squared. Ready for anything. The elevator glides to a stop, ding--! The doors open. They're both about to exit, when-- LAUGHTER fills the corridor. Healy frowns, listening. Wheezing, asthmatic laughter -- the kind, you think you'r gonna pass out, the joke's so fucking funny. HEALY leans out, cautiously... Just in time to see

dialogues.speaker: A SUITED MAN
dialogues.text: Stumbling toward him. Weaving, side to side. Equilibrium, gone. Wheeze... Stumble... Healy draws a sharp breath: From the guy's collar, a sad little spritz. Wheeze..! Like a kids' drinking fountain. Bright blood. Arterial. HIS THROAT'S BEEN CUT. Guy collides with the wall. Eyes, pleading with Healy...

dialogues.speaker: POUNDING FOOTSTEPS, NOW
dialogues.text: These from the OTHER direction. MARCH stares, eyes wide -

dialogues.speaker: A SIMILARLY DRESSED MAN
dialogues.text: Comes rocketing out of a side corridor. Headed their way Three loud, sharp REPORTS. BULLETS rip through his mid-section--! The window behind him, cracked. Splattered. He SCREAMS an the WHEEZER keeps on wheezing and all is blood and chaos HEALY doesn't say a word. Never changes expression. Leans back into the elevator. Reaches past March -- Pushes the "Lobby" button. The doors glide shut, erasing the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE, IN THE SKY
dialogues.text: The gut-shot MAN bursts through the picture window. Tumbles past the elevator --  82 Inside, Muzak plays, soothing. Healy slides the brass knuckles off. Stashes them in a pocket. Their visit to the penthouse, 15 seconds in duration. You know, it was never all that hot of an idea.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: (looking ill) Feels... like I'm gonna...

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Don't even think about it.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY'S CAR
dialogues.text: Squealing up out of the parking garage. Onto the street. Getting the fuck out of there. Fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March presses his forehead to the side window. His face, a study in despair... Without looking up:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Cops. Sure enough, STROBING RED, BLUE -- painting the buildings Without missing a beat, Healy swerves into an alley behin the Westin. Pulls over. Kills the ignition... Pause.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: You know, the thing is --

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Shut up. They sit. Checking the mirror. Saying nothing... The cops get farther away. Crickets resume chirping. Pause... the tension, palpable. March opens his mouth to wrap things up -- Something lands on the car. HARD. WHAM--! Buckles the roof. What in the name of God..? March claws for his weapon, then FREEZES as

dialogues.speaker: TINY HUMAN FEET
dialogues.text: Appear. On the WINDSHIELD.  83 Hearts in their throats, our guys swap glances.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: What the fu--?? FEET. Walking down the windshield...

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA, THEIR QUARRY
dialogues.text: Hobbles into view. Torn dress. Cuts, scratches. Poised at the hood, eyes crazed, hair wild --

dialogues.speaker: HOLY SHI--
dialogues.text: The moppet in the windshield SPINS, startled. Executes a little burlesque for their benefit: They watch, oddly detached, as she raises a BERETTA she's been clutching and BLASTS a shot through the windshield. KA-POW! The seat cushion blooms stuffing, as--

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA SLIPS--
dialogues.text: Goes over backwards. Tumbles from sight. Out of frame. Ju like that. Gunsmoke, hanging in the air. Silence. They both sit there. By unspoken assent, they clamber from the car, one on eac side. Find her splayed flat on her back. Unconscious. March glances up at the FIRE ESCAPE they've parked under. Looks at Healy. The wind blows. SIRENS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FRONT DOOR bursts open. March and Healy enter. Carryi the half-conscious AMELIA between them. HOLLY is in the living room playing TV PONG with her frie JESSICA. She jumps to her feet, surprised to see them:

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Holy shit, you got her! March is equally surprised to see his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here? You're supposed to be at Jessica's!  84 They walk/drag Amelia through the living room and into Holly's room. Lay her on the bed. Holly and Jessica tag along behind them.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mr. March, my sister kicked us out. She was having some guy over, didn't want us around.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: (still pissed) Yeah... Well... Your sister's a slut.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: I know. On the bed, Amelia's eyes flutter open. She squints.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Feel well enough to talk? We got some questions. She shifts her gaze to Healy. Eyes focusing.

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: You were... You were supposed to get these guys off of me.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Amelia, do you know what they want? Who sent them?

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know... It was my mother. March and Healy exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Why don't you start from the top? Amelia shuts her eyes again. Tired.

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: Why? It doesn't matter. It-- (stops, sighs, then) I... made a film... With Dean, my boyfriend. The idea was we'd do this... artistic, uh, film. Experimental film--

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Porno film? Amelia's eyes snap back open.  Pause. 85

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: It's not a porno! Look, do you know who my mother is?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Yes. We've met her. We talked to her.

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: (bitter) What'd she tell you..? That I was a loon? That I was lashing out?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... My mother is a criminal. She's one of them.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Them..? Who's them?

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: She's one of the insiders. She's one of the capitalist, corporate suppressors. (getting worked up) She's one of the elite fear-mongers. And her and her pig cronies have us in the cross-hairs. We're just pawns, man! They're trying to kill us all!

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Gosh.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: So, you're saying your mother is... bad?

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: -.. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Does this have anything to do with the birds? Amelia lets her head fall back again. Closing her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: My mother is supposed to be working for the Justice Department, right?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Sure. She's prosecuting that car thing.  86

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Only she's not... I mean, she's not prosecuting it. The automakers..? She's gonna let ‘em walk.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: But... they have evidence--

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: Sure, they have evidence. They've got memos proving Detroit conspired to suppress the converter. Proving they'd rather poison our air than spend a little money... (warming again) But my mother's gonna say it's not enough to convict. She's gonna lie. She's on the take. Money, again, right? Mammon, that's her god. That FASCIST, CAPITALIST --

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: (cutting in) Okay, okay..! Back up. How do you know this? Amelia calms again.

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: I was spying on her... I listened in on her phone calls.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: So why didn't you just go to the police?

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: She is the police! She's the head of the Justice Department!

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Then to a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Look, these people all work together! You been living under a rock?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: So you decided to make a... porno film?

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: It's not a porno. We made a statement. And yes, it contained nudity --  87

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: And porn stars..?

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: That's just the commercial element. Okay? Sid said we had to have that... The reality was, we were gonna get our message out there... It was all in the film. Names. Dates. Everything. Everything my mom was doing. Once it got out, once it was in theaters there was no way they could suppress it. No way to cover it up.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: I just want to get this straight. You made a porno -- where the important part was the plot?

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: What's your hang-up, man?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: So, it's not about the actors, the sex, nothing. It's the fucking story? That's what you're telling us? Amelia nods, calming again.

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: ... My mom found out about it. Killed Dean. Destroyed all his work...

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Your mom killed Dean?

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: Of course. She killed Misty, too.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: And Sid Shattuck?

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. March nods.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: So, it's like, uh, Jack the Ripper and then your mom.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: So what are you gonna do?  88

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: ... I don't know... I haven't figured it out yet... (leans back, eyes flutter) I'm just tired now. I'm tired.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Right... Well, we'll think on it. You, uh, get some rest. They all step out of the room. Close the door.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: What do you think..?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I like her!

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: I like her dress.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: I think she's a loon. According to her, her mother is single-handedly taking down all of western society.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: (nods ) Yeah. People do want to kill her though... Like John Boy.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Maybe he heard her talk for five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Who's John Boy?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: He's on "The Waltons."

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: This is a different John Boy.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: We think. The phone in the kitchen starts to RING. March gets it.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: This is March.

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: 89 Judith Kuttner's assistant. She stands in the middle of a well-appointed study at Kuttner's house.

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: Mr. March, this is Tally... I don't know who else to call.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Tally..? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: I don't know quite how to say this. So I'll just say it -- I think Judith, Mrs. Kuttner, I think she may be involved in something... How do I put it...

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Illegal..?

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: I wouldn't go that far. Shady. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Well, her kid certainly seems to think so.

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: Amelia? Did you talk to her? Is she safe?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Yeah. She's here now. A little banged up, but still intact. (beat) She thinks her mom is a one woman crime spree.

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: That's insane. Whatever Judith's doing, it's to benefit Amelia, bet on it -- still... (plunges in) I just got a call from her... She wouldn't explain herself. But she said she needed $100,000 dollars in cash.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: I don't know. I think she's in trouble. She sounded... scared.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Scared?  90

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: I can send the family doctor to look after Amelia, if-- (pause) Mr. March, would you be willing to carry the money for me?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Carry the money..?

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: I don't know where else to turn. And I'm worried about Judith... Will you help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March and Healy lean against March's car. Waiting for Tal March finishes a cigarette. Checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Tally should be here any minute.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: (nods absently) Wish I knew who to believe on this thing.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Tell you what, that kid's a write-off.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: She's misguided.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: She's NUTS. She won't be happy ‘til there's a bird in the White House. A pause... Then Healy shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Maybe they're both telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: (frowns, then) I had this friend, right? In the Secret Service. Worked the Nixon detail -- this was after they threw him outta office... (beat) Anyway, one day Nixon is out driving, down near San Clemente. Just him and a few agents. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HEALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And they come upon this accident, first ones on the scene. Guy pinned under his own car. So, NIXON gets out, RUNS to the guy's side to check on him... Nixon says to him, "You're gonna be fine, son. You're gonna be okay." But then, the guy just dies, right there. Pause. March has a vaguely constipated look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Just look at it from the other guy's point of view. The guy that died... He's out, driving along one day. Gets ina horrible accident. And he's laying there, near death. Staring up at the sky... And former president RICHARD NIXON appears to him... Tells him he's gonna be fine. (beat) What did that guy think? Did he think this was normal..? You know, that everyone sees Nixon before they die--

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: You're expecting an angel, you get this shit.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Right... Same situation... Just looks vastly different depending on your point of view. That's what I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: It all just depends on your point of view.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Sure. Right--

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: --how you look at it.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Yeah. What's wrong..?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: For Chrissakes, you tell me this epic fucking story, and ten minutes later the point is there's two ways of looking at things? Why not save time and say, "There's two ways of looking at things."  92 Healy just shrugs. March rubs his eyes. Tired. Lights another cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: ..-. Be kind of a bummer, that's what death was like. Healy nods...

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Could be worse... Could be Agnew.

dialogues.speaker: A GREY MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Pulls up along side them. TALLY gets out. Carrying a LARG METAL SUITCASE. She sets it on the hood of March's car. Looks at our guys:

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: That's it. $100,000. I packed it myself... It wasn't easy putting this together on short notice. March and Healy offer no reply. She regards them oddly:

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: I want to thank you, for doing this. (beat) It's nice to have people like you in the world, still... What are we gonna do once we run out? Healy stands, pulls the suitcase toward him.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: So, tell us where to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March driving. Healy in the passenger seat, eyes closed. metal SUITCASE rests on the backseat. March drives in silence. Smoking... But then, after a few moments, his eyelids start to droop. He shakes it off.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Man, I'm getting kinda tired here... (glances over) Healy? Healy SNORES lightly.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Terrific...  93 He stares back out the windshield. Concentrates on drivin But his eyelids grow heavy again. His eyes shut for a sec He snaps them back open:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Shit. Hey, Healy? Wake up! Healy mumbles something. Looks over:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Sorry, I'm falling asleep here, man. You're gonna have to drive.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Alright. Pull over at the next turn off.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Okay, cool... (beat) Listen, you worried at all -- I mean about making this drop?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Not me... I got insurance-- He pulls up his pants leg revealing an S&W AIRWEIGHT REVO in an ankle holster.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: This baby right here... Never leaves me. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Cute... Let's just hope you don't have to use it. (noticing) I'll pull off here.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: You know what? You don't need to pull off... The car can drive itself.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: (confused) What are you talking about..?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Just let go of the wheel, man. March considers for a second... Then tentatively lets go of the wheel--  94 And sure enough, as they approach a bend in the road, the car turns all by itself... March looks delighted:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Hey, I didn't know it could do that!

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: You kidding? All cars can drive themselves. It's amazing what Detroit can do these days. From the back seat, a GIANT, MONSTROUS KILLER BEE, roughl feet tall, LEANS FORWARD. Turns it's humongous COMPOUND E towards March. Oversized tongue protruding, says:

dialogues.speaker: GIANT KILLER BEE
dialogues.text: Yeah, March, where the fuck have you been?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Like you know! You don't even drive, you fly everywhere, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: He's got a point there, Bumble... You can't even WHAT THE FUCK ARE YOU DOING?!

dialogues.speaker: MARCH'S EYES SNAP OPEN
dialogues.text: He fell asleep at the wheel. He's been dreaming. Healy is YELLING at him:

dialogues.speaker: LOOK OUT GODDAMNIT
dialogues.text: March whips his head around-- They're headed right for a CONCRETE OVERPASS SUPPORT. HE SLAMS ON THE BRAKES. Too late -- WHAM! -- THEY SMASH INTO THE SUPPORT HEAD ON. March and Healy jolted against their seatbelts as the car to an immediate stop. The front end STOVED IN. THE METAL SUITCASE launched out of the back seat. SHATTERS the front windshield. Keeps going -- SMACK! -- IMPACTS against the concrete support. Breaking open. Showering SHREDDED NEWSPAPER everywhere. March and Healy stare out the broken windshield. In shock. Silent. Stunned.  95 The newspaper rains down all over the car. There is no money in the suitcase. It takes awhile for all this to process. March blinks:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: The suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: (swallows ) I know.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: There's no money.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: I know. A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Maybe someone... Messed with it... I mean, uh--

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Tally packed the money herself. She said so. (beat) She totally fucked us.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Yeah... (frowns ) Doesn't... make sense, I mean, why? What good's it do to... send us off on a... a thing, a--

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: --a wild goose chase.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Wild goose chase, exactly. Take us out of the city...

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Three, four hours... When we could be back dealing with Amelia and-- March stops cold. The same exact second as Healy. Fear swims in their eyes. They exchange a look--  96

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Motherf--! March keys the ignition. The engine catches -- sounds lik but at least it runs... Slams it into reverse -- PULLS FREE of the concrete support. BLASTS backwards--! Throws a smoking 180, as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly plays solitaire. Tries to ignore the background jab of JESSICA, phone welded to her chin: JESSICA (on phone) ..-.- No, like the Waltons. Yeah, on TV. Uh-huh. Richard something. Thing on his face, yeah. What's that actor's name? THE DOORBELL RINGS. Holly gets up --

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Jess, get off the phone. JESSICA (on phone) Yeah, yeah. Anyway, this new John Boy's like, a murderer. Shit, now it's gonna bug me, who was that actor..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUSY SIGNAL. MARCH slams down the phone. Frenzied. Flin himself into the car, waves at HEALY, go, go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly opens the FRONT DOOR. On the other side, a tall, bland-looking man with a medical bag:

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You're Holly..? (extends his hand) Dr. Malek.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Hi. She's inside. Come in. He smiles amiably. Shrugs out of his coat. Shuts the door

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Mind fetching your Dad?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Uh... he's running an errand.  97

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Yeah? Back anytime soon?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Oh. Hour, tops.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Fine. Now, then, Nurse Holly, how's our patient? That's her? He points to JESSICA, who flashes a brisk Ally-Sheedy wav Never looks up.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: No, that's Jessica. What she's got you can't fix. (points to bedroom) In there asleep. Slight fever.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: On drugs, you think? What was she saying? Was she making sense? He crosses to the bedroom. Turns, and for the first time something captures Holly's attention:

dialogues.speaker: ON HIS CHEEK
dialogues.text: Just below the right ear, looms a large, discolored LUMP. mole. Holly watches it go by... mesmerized. Frozen.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: She... uh, she called us fascists. Holly, heart pounding now. And it gets worse -- an oblivi JESSICA picks this moment to chime in:

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Holly. What's the name of that actor on the Waltons? Richard something. With the hockey puck on his face. Beside Holly, the man goes very STILL. The temperature in the room seems to drop. A FLICKER. He recovers quickly, like he never heard -- Too late. Holly saw. She knows. With affected casualness, she crosses to the counter:

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: That show's for retards. Dr. Malek, would you like a cookie? Just baked 'em.  98

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: None left. I looked, remember?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (quiet desperation) No, there's a couple. Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR/JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: I could be persuaded. After I've had a look at Sleeping Beaut-- He stops. Turns, eyes flat and dead. Becomes quite still-

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY HAS A GUN IN HER HAND
dialogues.text: The gun she just lifted from March's COOKIE JAR.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: Nurse Holly..? Ten feet separate them. John Boy smiles. Raises his hands The MEDICAL BAG drops. A SYRINGE rolls free -- Jessica just now noticing the gun--

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Holly, what are you doing?! Are you CRAZY? Holly licks dry lips, says to John Boy:

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: There are handcuffs in the desk, asshole. Get them. Slow. John Boy, so still it's frightening. Brow furrowed. Like he's listening to a radio only he can hear.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: HEY! Did you hear me? Pause... he looks up. Consults his watch.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: This is really slowing me down, Holly. JESSICA, still in shock.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: HOLLY! What's going on?!

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (clenched teeth) Jessica, it's him. He's the guy.  99 John Boy reaches in his pants. The action so casual Holly doesn't think to stop him. From the waistband, he produce straight-razor.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: Jessica, if you help me with this, I'll only kill Holly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March's CAR slingshots into view, past Holly's vacant LOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March, focused. Healy stuffing an extra gun clip in his c

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Come on, now... 68 and sunny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN BOY seems, if anything, MORE casual now. As he slowl walks toward Holly. A dreadful stillness about him.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Jessica. Dial 911. John Boy cocks his head. Hears a car, faint in the distan Keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: Jessica..? I wouldn't do that if I were you.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Jessica, DON'T LISTEN. The pressure, simply too much. Jessica's just a kid, she BOLTS--! Rushes headlong for the door --

dialogues.speaker: CROSSES BETWEEN HOLLY AND JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: Mistake. A split-second advantage, and John Boy takes it. With no seeming effort, he GRABS JESSICA. SLINGS her round in front of him. Facing the GUN. HOISTS her into the air, legs kicking -- AND HURLS HER. It's bizarre. All his might, flat-out THROWS her at Holly Here she comes... Surreal. Holly DUCKS.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA PINWHEELS PAST HER--
dialogues.text: 100 Goes CRASHING though a side WINDOW. An explosion of glass She vanishes into the night, as --

dialogues.speaker: HEADLIGHTS
dialogues.text: Flash through the FRONT WINDOWS of the house. John Boy se it, reacts instantly -- turns, heads for the front door--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cavalry is here. HEALY AND MARCH burst from their CAR

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Did you hear that..?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: (slight head shake) Dunno... Whose car is tha-- He stops, mid-sentence. AS A STRANGE MAN casually crosses March's front lawn. In no great hurry. He spots March and Healy. Waves.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: ‘Evening. Healy and March, thrown. The guy, so utterly unperturbed.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Hey... Do you know what that loud noise was? The words hang in the air. JOHN BOY pauses at his car. Casually opens the trunk, reaches inside --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: Yeah, just now..? I threw that girl out the window. Healy reacts instantly:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Healy TACKLES March behind a PLANTER-- As JOHN BOY comes up FIRING. A STERLING SUBMACHINE GUN. FULL AUTO. Rips the suburban nighttime to pieces. March's car takes the first fusillade. Tires blown. Glass shattered. John Boy swivels, targets the planter. Chunks concrete go flying.  101 March rolls out to one side, looks up -- SEES JESSICA. At the side of the house. Lying there.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS CHRIST..
dialogues.text: Without thought, he powers to his feet. Sprints across tw feet of lawn. GUNFIRE chasing him. Earth shooting up in g He flings himself FLAT around the side of the house. Comb crawls to Jessica. Checks her. Alive. Gathers her up, as

dialogues.speaker: BACK OUT ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Healy is making a move. First lull in the fire, he BOOKS. Across the drive. Towards March's car -- LUNGES across the front of it. Clears the hood. Touches down. Rolls. Gun aimed, UNDER THE CAR, towards John Boy's feet. SWEARS John Boy is LOOKING BACK. The killer lies flat. Already aiming under the car. Healy jumps, CLINGS to the door panel, as the world ERUPTS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March bursts in the side door, carrying Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: He half-runs, half-staggers. Rounds the corner --

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY AND AMELIA
dialogues.text: Are crouched, hugging each other.

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: Fucking fascists!

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Dad..!

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, okay. Come on. He pushes them into the bedroom. Places Jessica on the be

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Stay here. Don't move. He takes the GUN from Holly.  102 Runs to the FRONT of the house, and meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Behind a eucalyptus TREE. Every few seconds he thrusts ou an arm, FIRES. Shooting blind. The TREE gets RIPPED TO SPLINTERS in response. John Boy's head snaps sideways. Sees MARCH inside the hou Doesn't miss a beat -- Draws a SECOND WEAPON from the trunk of his car. A HANDGUN. Targets March with it. While still firing at HEALY, he aims the other gun. Blows SHOT AFTER SHOT through the front WINDOW at March's scuttling form. Glass, COLLAPSING. John Boy drop-stuffs new clips so fast it's scary. Slap-click--! Slap-click--! In the midst of this, he pauses to check his watch. Frown annoyed. Off-schedule. It's taking too long --

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE
dialogues.text: JESSICA, now, stirring. HOLLY crouches:

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Amelia, gimme a han-- (swivels round) Amelia? Reacts, startled. AMELIA, poised in the WINDOW. Overlooki the steeply pitched BACK YARD.

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA
dialogues.text: Tell Mr. Healy thanks for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Wait -- Amelia, NO!! Amelia JUMPS. Slips from view, plummets -- CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: FRONT YARD
dialogues.text: He picks his moment -- BREAKS COVER. Spins into view. Puts three in the raised TRUNK LID, pow- pow-pow-! JOHN BOY, now, forced to dodge -- Healy sprints. DIVES through the shattered front WINDOW o March's house. Hits, rolls... Comes up running --  103

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back out the fucking window as he races toward cover--

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE, JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: Decides on retreat. Distant SIRENS, now. Approaching. He climbs behind the wheel of his car -- SHRIEKS out of the driveway. In a cloud of brick and stuc Right then, the EUCALYPTUS TREE finally BREAKS IN TWO-- Slams down with a THUNDEROUS CRACK--! Just missing his ca He screeches away. Brow slightly furrowed. Disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crouched low, MARCH arrives at the bedroom. Opens the doo

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Oh, no... HOLLY, in tears... He moves to the window, peers out: A 15-FOOT DROP, TO THE HILLSIDE. Amelia nowhere to be see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't take JOHN BOY long to realize he's riding on RIMS. Two blocks from March's, he PULLS OVER. Gets out... Approaches a random CAR. Goes to break the GLASS, stops - A POLICE CAR is approaching. The first to respond. Inbound. 30 yards out. In a split-second? John Boy changes tactics. Walks right out INTO THE ROAD. Waves his arms frantically The police cruiser SLEWS to a halt. The COP gets out, one hand on his weapon...

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Sir? Please calmly tell me what th-- He's candy. John Boy MOVES. FAST. Spins the cop. Bounces his head off the hood. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN BOY at the wheel. He hits the flashers, just for fun Checks the rear view -- Can hardly believe his LUCK:  104 Because there, running up the road, SCREAMING for him to STOP... is none other than AMELIA. He permits himself a smile. CUT TO BLACK. PAUSE. FADE IN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE CRUISERS, six of them. Flashers turning. The night wears on. Everyone's dead tired. MARCH wanders in circles. Takes an interest in the ground

dialogues.speaker: AMELIA KUTTNER
dialogues.text: Is a blanket-covered lump in the middle of the road. Pitifully small. COPS swarm round. All too late. HEALY says nothing. Looks on, his face unreadable. His client, dead. She paid him. He just stands there. There's nothing he can do. And so he just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March and Healy sit, HANDCUFFED to a bench in the hallway March stares at the ground. Healy gazes at the ceiling. They're silent. We hear the low murmur of station activity in the backgro We hold... Finally, a man enters frame. Suit, tie. Lawyer

dialogues.speaker: PERRY THE LAWYER
dialogues.text: Alright, guys. They're letting you out on your own recognizance... You'll be processed and free in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: What about Kuttner? Did they question her?

dialogues.speaker: PERRY THE LAWYER
dialogues.text: (deep breath) No. They didn't... They're not going to.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Perry, listen to me--

dialogues.speaker: PERRY THE LAWYER
dialogues.text: No, March, you listen... You're lucky to be getting out at all. She's the head of the Justice Department, you can't come in here spouting this crap and expect --  105

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Perry, it's true. She had her daughter killed--

dialogues.speaker: PERRY THE LAWYER
dialogues.text: March, it's your word against Kuttner's. You lose... They're gonna want to question you some more in the next couple of days -- (beat) You might want to think about changing your story. March falls silent. Healy continues to stare at the ceili

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars backed up as far as the eye can see. It's rush hour nobody's moving. A thick CRUST OF SMOG hangs over the cit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March and Healy in the back seat. Holly up by the driver. They inch along, breathing exhaust fumes. March stares out the window. From up here on the overpass he's got a nice hazy view of the city in the morning sun.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: You know those idiots -- those protester idiots? Healy looks over.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: I think they were right... The birds can't breathe.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Think so?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think so. Silence. They inch forward some more.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Amelia dead. Misty, Shattuck. All dead. The rest of us get to choke -- (looks over) No one cares.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Well, it looks that way.  106

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Guess that's how it goes sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: That's how it goes a lot of the time.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Yeah... (beat) I need a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAB pulls up outside of what's left of March's house. Glass broken. Bullet holes. Police tape. March and Holly climb out and stare at their home while Healy pays the driver.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: In some ways, it's kind of an improvement, you know?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Yeah... Grab whatever you need and we'll stay in a motel or something... For tonight anyway. Holly disappears inside the house, just as a huge BOAT of car pulls up to the curb outside. Parks awkwardly. An old woman gets out. We recognize her. It's Lily Glenn, Misty's aunt. She approaches March. Looking determined ag

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: (last thing he needs) Mrs. Glenn, hello... I know you've been calling. I've been a little busy.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GLENN
dialogues.text: Well, I just-- (stops, seeing house) Oh, my! Your house!

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Yes, my house. We're remodeling... Mrs. Glenn, perhaps now is not the time-- The old woman, sensing the brush off, ignores the house looking like a war zone. Puts her determined face back on

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GLENN
dialogues.text: Now is the time, Mr. March. Have you made any progress on my case?  107

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: No, Mrs. Glenn. Not really... I'm not sure I'm going to. She notices Healy, seemingly for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GLENN
dialogues.text: He's supposed to be looking for my niece!

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Um, yes. Heard about that.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GLENN
dialogues.text: She's alive, too. I know because I saw her. Only, nobody believes me. Why won't they believe me?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Um, I don't know, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GLENN
dialogues.text: I saw her at her house! Right through the front window, clear as day! She was writing something at a desk. She was wearing a blue pinstriped jacket...

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Sure. I've seen that jacket.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Mrs. Glenn, please... I need to get-- (stops, catching something) What'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: What. .?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: You've seen that jacket.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Yeah. At Shattuck's. It was in his office with a bunch of other wardrobe.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: The jacket was in his office?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Yeah. A blue, pinstriped jacket. Had Misty's name on it. It was for the film.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Wardrobe. For the film.  108

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: I think I just said that. March blinks once. And suddenly he gets it.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Holy fucking shit!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GLENN
dialogues.text: (reacts to language) Oh, my..! Healy's totally lost now. March, suddenly excited.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Mrs. Glenn, I need you to take us to Misty's and show us exactly what you saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCH steers to a halt outside Misty Mountains' Hollywood Hills hideaway. It looks forlorn after only a week. As they all exit the car, LILY speaks excitedly:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GLENN
dialogues.text: There. That's the window. March is silent. Intent. Uses Lily's KEY, opens the door-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spacious living room. Lot of BUILT-INS: Cabinets, console Psychedelic furnishings, erotic art. HEALY sizes it up, t states the obvious:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Glenn. There's no desk in this room.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GLENN
dialogues.text: (flustered) Well I... I don't know what to say... MARCH, meanwhile, is looking around. Staring up at the ceiling. Examining the floor. Holly watches him:

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Dad, what are you doing? March bumps the coffee table. It's pretty heavy. He kicks again. It's really heavy. Starts checking it over.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Just hang on... Hang on...  109 There's a long split down the middle of the table. He tri to get his fingers in there. Feels underneath it. Hits a latch... The coffee table splits open. We see something inside. Elevating. EMERGING. He grins -- A MOVIE PROJECTOR rises into view. LOCKS in position, click--! Pause. There it sits.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GLENN
dialogues.text: I don't understand. He turns to her, eyes twinkling.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Very simple. You did see your niece that night, Mrs. Glenn. You saw her on that wall. At a desk. In a pin-striped suit. He rummages inside the console. Healy, confused --

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Wait. So what she saw... she was looking at a MOVIE?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Not a movie. THE movie. Misty's farewell performance. Projected on that wall.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: You can't be serious.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: You got a better idea?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: All the copies of the film burned up.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Then how did Lily watch it through that window two days after it supposedly burned? Chrissakes, the WARDROBE matches. LILY stammers:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GLENN
dialogues.text: I... I'm confused -- They pay her no heed.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: What if Amelia lied to us?  110

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: You're saying she made a copy?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: A copy, yes. Wouldn't you?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: And gave it to Misty.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: YES. That night she came, checked the film against that wall, then carried it off with her -- all while Lily watched. Healy, wheels turning. LILY tugs March's arm:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GLENN
dialogues.text: I need to ask something --

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: I dunno, March. That's pretty thin... But now, against his will, HEALY's hooked. He snaps his fingers. Looks up, eyes wide:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: The businessmen.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: At the Westin, remember? Bartender said she was meeting some dudes out of New York. Conducting some kinda business --

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Selling them the film. (excited) See? What'd I tell you? It's out there, man. The film still EXISTS. They exchange triumphant looks. LILY, insistent now:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GLENN
dialogues.text: Please... please stop talking. They all trail off. Turn, to find her looking STRICKEN.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GLENN
dialogues.text: I listened to everything you said... Does this mean... (lip trembles) Does this mean my niece is dead..?  111 Awkward pause. Holly avoids her gaze. Healy looks pained.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: She was murdered, Lily.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GLENN
dialogues.text: ...I see.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: But we're gonna get the people who did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEALY, HOLLY AND MARCH hustle through the HOSPITAL doors. Moving fast and loose --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Remember the WHEEZING GUY, from a few pages back? T Airport Westin sequence -- his throat cut, exactly, that guy. Well, he's HERE, in bed. A survivor. Private room. Hushed, dim. He lies still. Throat bandaged He hears a sound. Looks up -- Sees HEALY enter furtively, beckon to MARCH and HOLLY. The guy goes rigid. They approach. Huffing, out of breath. Flank the bed. Mar elected spokesman. He smiles, offers pad and paper:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Hi, I don't know if you remember us, but we have a couple questions. If you can just, you know, write the answers -- The guy RECOILS. Swats away pad and pen. Scared witless. Actually makes MEWLING noises.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Whoa! Easy! No one's here to hurt you. The man seems to think otherwise. Seems INCONSOLABLE. March frowns:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Damn. What's this guy's problem? I mean, yeah, the cut throat. Obviously -- HEALY tumbles to it first. Leans in, gaze steady:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: We're not with anyone else. Okay? (beat) Sir, was someone else here?  112

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (catching on) Um, yeah. About six-two? Blond hair, big thing on his face? At this, the Wheezer stops struggling and promptly faints dead away. March shakes him. Again. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Swell. Now what? March leans back against the wall to wait. Kicks somethin on the floor. Look down.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Hey... Check out the floor. There's numerous scraps of NOTEPAPER, scattered all over linoleum by the bed. Healy stoops. Grabs one. Whistles:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: I'll be damned... John Boy did question him.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: How can you be sure? Healy flashes the note: "DON'T KILL ME." March immediatel gets down on his knees, starts snatching up notes. Readin them. Holly follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: (reading) "Please... Please..." (grimaces) That's useful. Holly's got one:

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (reading) "No... We didn't get it yet..."

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Didn't get what? The film? Holly just shrugs. Healy thinking:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: She didn't give it them, maybe? Not yet?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: They never took possession? Oh, great. That's just great. And now she's dead.  113 Healy grabs another note:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: "After they were done with it..." (thinking) Hand over the film, after they're done with it. THEY. Her protest group?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: The Birdy Bunch. "Done with it.." What does that mean? They scramble through more notes. Discarding one after another until March finds:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: "Her friend is a projectionist." Healy stops... Frowns:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Is that... Are they talking about that protester kid, you know--

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: The idiot kid.... Chet! That was his name! Chet! Holly finds another note. Reads it:

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: "At the L.A. Auto show." MARCH and HEALY both freeze.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: The Auto Show. Isn't that, like, tonight..?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Yeah... Big party. All the mucky-mucks'11 be there... The press, everyone...

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: You don't think--

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Great place to get the message to the people, you know..? Off March's look we CUT TO:  114

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below us, a sprawling HOTEL COMPLEX. Opposite the L.A. Convention Center.

dialogues.speaker: THREE HI-RISE TOWERS
dialogues.text: Form a "U" around a ground-level COURTYARD. Swank. Ritzy. CARS rotate on huge PEDESTALS down there. As SEARCH-LIGHT sweep the sky. There's even a dance floor on the ROOFTOP. Welcome to the L.A. Auto Show's GALA OPENING NIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We spot MARCH, HEALY and HOLLY moving among the rich and dressed. They push through the bustle of activity. Harrie of breath... MARCH corrals a passing SECURITY GUARD:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Hi there! We're looking for the projection room. The guy points up, past a giant suspended MOVIE SCREEN -- the far side of the hotel, dotted with windows.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Ninth floor. You have a pass..?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Sure. We have a pass. (the guy leaves) We don't have a pass. HOLLY, ever-helpful:

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: They gotta let hotel guests up, right? Before they can respond, Holly leans over, and as they pa a POOLSIDE TABLE -- she snags a set of keys from two oblivious CHATTING GUESTS. March smiles. Chip off the old block. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music, heard faintly. Our guys come barreling out of the elevator. Down the HALLWAY... The whole floor's been taken over by the show. Makeshift taped to the doors. They pass a guy, March flags him:  115

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Hey, you seen Chet? The projectionist?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Just left... Like ten minutes ago. Went for a drink. And you are..?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: In a hurry. Thanks, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: (frowns ) How'd you know my name was Buddy? They round the corner. Still moving. Scanning paper signs Healy spots one that reads "MOVIE ROOM." Nudges March. They try the door. Locked. March signals Holly, still at far end of the hallway:

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Check down there... We clear? Holly looks both ways. Gives March the thumbs up. Healy grabs the handle. APPLIES HIS WEIGHT to the door pa Shifting. Heaving. An audible SNAP--! March motions for Holly to keep an eye out, as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter what looks like a fairly nice hotel SUITE. Cou chairs, parquet floors. And there, aimed out the WINDOW - A BIG CLUNKY PROJECTOR, rented for the occasion. THERE'S A FILM IN IT, threaded onto a PLATTER. Healy crosses the room. Plucks at the leader, unspools te feet of film. Holds it to the light --

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Well. .?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: (blinks, perplexed) It's... a bunch of cars. March hunkers down. Pores over the footage.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: "Motor City Pride." This isn't it. It's not the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The projectionist, he must still have it stashed somewhere. From BEHIND them issues a calm, clear VOICE: VOICE (0.s.) My thinking, exactly. They SPIN, startled -- IT'S TALLY. In one hand, a bright, distractingly GREEN WA TALKIE. In the other, an equally distracting AUTOMATIC. She closes the HOTEL DOOR without looking, actually slams right in Holly's FACE, locks her out--

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Hey, Tally, how's it going? Wow, you look great. Nice gun. She waggles the automatic:

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: Got it special for you. Weapons on the floor. Now. Healy sighs. Unlimbers a revolver, tosses it. Ditto March

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: You kill the projectionist..?

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: No. My associate's out looking for him now. We'll find him. Healy squints at her. Sizing her up--

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Tell me, Tally. Ever killed anybody?

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: In Detroit, yes. Three times.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: (not what he was expecting) Oh... Really?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: That's where this mess began, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: Sorry?  117

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Detroit. Misty Mountains was at that auto show. Last month.

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: (shrugs) She was stupid. Kept bragging about her new movie. The stir it would cause.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Tally, listen. You're not a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: She did kill three people --

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: I mean, you know, deep down. Abruptly, there is a sharp KNOCKING at the door. A poorly disguised VOICE calls: HOLLY (o.s.) Room service..? Tally frowns. Her attention drawn to the door, briefly-- And that's enough time for MARCH to MAKE HIS MOVE. He drops to the FLOOR. Darts out an arm -- Grabs the CUFF OF HEALY'S PANTS. Frantic. Searching. Healy frowns down at him... Tally, too... Gun still level as March determinedly goes for Healy's OTHER leg--

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: What's wrong with him?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Not sure. (to March) Um... March? What the fuck are you doing? Just curious. March sits up, a trifle breathless--

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Shit. I was going for the gun... I guess you musta moved it...

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: What gun?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: The one you showed me... Your ankle gun.  118

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Who told you I had an ankle gun?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: You did. You showed me, remember? (floundering) You know, on the -- the road. Last night, right before we hit that, um... (frowns ) Hang on. Did I... dream that..?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Are you serious? Are you fucking serious?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: No, no, wait--

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: You DREAMT IT, you moron. There's no ankle holster. Wow. WOW. This takes the prize--

dialogues.speaker: SHUT UP, BOTH OF YOU
dialogues.text: Tally unlocks the door:

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: Holly..? You can come in. Holly, enters, pushing a small service tray.

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: Very clever, Holly.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Thanks, I thought so-- And on the word "so" Holly moves. Fast. Snatches the COFF POT off the tray and flings it at Tally... Covering her w

dialogues.speaker: SCALDING HOT LIQUID--
dialogues.text: Only Tally doesn't seem all that bothered. Perhaps the fa the coffee isn't actually hot has something to do with it

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: Why did you just throw cold coffee on me?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (sheepish) I got it in the hallway... I thought it was hot. Tally just shakes her head. Moves to close the door--  AND SLIPS... Slips on the coffee puddle at her feet. She goes down with a YELP. CRACKING her head on the doork The GUN in her hand discharging, BLAM-! Takes out a lamp. And she's OUT COLD. That quick. March pops to his feet. All business.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Well, that worked out... Now, we gotta find this projectionist before John Boy.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: That guy said he went for a drink... Take the upstairs bar. I'll take downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHET, THE PROJECTIONIST, sits at the bar looking nervous. Checks his watch for the umpteenth time. Glances around. A MAN steps up a few feet away. Scans the crowd. Tall, broad, easy-going grin. Giant mole... John Boy.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: Anyone here seen the projectionist? CHET gives an involuntary start. John Boy catches it. Tur

dialogues.speaker: JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: You're the projectionist..? Look, we got a problem on nine. Someone knocked over the projector. Film's all over the floor.

dialogues.speaker: PROJECTIONIST
dialogues.text: The film's on the floor, really?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: Yeah, fuckin' mess. Follow me..? CHET nods, gulps his scotch. John Boy waits, smiling. CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smaller, more exclusive version of the party downstairs MARCH AND HOLLY step out of the elevator. Survey the scen

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Stay here. Guard the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Dad, I want to help--  120

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Good. You can push the button for me when I get back. He walks away, leaving her fuming. Heads over to the bar. (Clearly a different bar than the one we just saw Chet at Starts scanning the crowd in vain. Absently plops down on a barstool... The second he does, hand taps him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Hey, pal, what can I do for you..?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: (spins his chair around) Excuse me..?

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER, (VOICE)
dialogues.text: Free drinks, man. What'll you have? March blinks at the endless line of bottles behind the ba

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: «+. Free drinks..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Healy makes his way through the crowds. Spots the main ba Pushes towards it... Catches the bartender's attention:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm looking for a guy about Five- five. Brown hair. He's supposed to be running the projector for us--

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah. Guy already came and got him. Something about film on the floor, right?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Which way did they go?

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: They took the service door, right over-- But Healy's already on the move. We follow him as he push through the service exit. He jogs down the corridor, tries the door a the far end - leads to a LOADING DOCK. Empty. He starts to head back in, when a NOISE startles h He spins. Movement, there... Inside one of the dumpsters.  121 Healy runs over -- A BLOOD-covered CHET THE PROJECTIONIST is in the dumpster Barely moving. Eyes glassy.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Jesus, Chet! Can you hear me? Chet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly by the elevator, being ignored by the ultra-rich. Something catches her eye:

dialogues.speaker: A DISTRACTINGLY GREEN WALKIE-TALKIE
dialogues.text: Clipped to someone's BELT. Looks just like the one TALLY Holly leaves her position to get a look at the OWNER... Medium height. Compact. Not young; definitely an older gu He turns -- OH, SHIT. It not an older guy -- It's the OLDER GUY. His arm in a sling. Pledge to HEALY, forgotten. Holly creeps closer to him, trying to act casual as we CU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN BOY strides quickly up the stairs to the terrace lev Casually wiping something off his hands with a handkerchi Nearly collides with a party guest. A guy we recognize. F by two BURLY BODYGUARDS. It's Bergen Paulsen, the car com exec from TV. They lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PAULSEN
dialogues.text: What... What're you doing here..? I can't be seen with you.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: The film... It's here.

dialogues.speaker: PAULSEN
dialogues.text: Here!? Just what are we paying you for!? You were supposed to take care of it! John Boy fixes him with a dead stare. Unnerving. Says:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: I am. Then turns, keeps walking. Looking annoyed now. Reaches into his coat pocket. Takes out a Walkie-Talkie.  122

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With OLDER GUY as John Boy's VOICE CRACKLES from the walk talkie on his belt: JOHN BOY (on walkie) The film's in the projector, repeat, in the projector. Older Guy snatches up his radio:

dialogues.speaker: OLDER GUY
dialogues.text: What..? We already checked--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: It's spliced into the other film. Right in the middle of it... Go get it.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER GUY
dialogues.text: On my way. He clicks off. Stands, all business. Starts to go... But some sixth sense STOPS him. He frowns. Turns: Locks eyes with HOLLY. To date, they've not met. No matter. Recognition flashes between them. She heard. She KNOWS. It's in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER GUY
dialogues.text: Don't you know it's rude to eavesdrop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCH, still sitting at the bar. OLDER GUY and HOLLY step behind him... OLDER GUY leans down, says in March's ear:

dialogues.speaker: OLDER GUY
dialogues.text: I've got a gun pointed at your daughter's spine... Come with me. March turns, straightens, a big lop-sided GRIN on face. Oddly? Doesn't seem any too frightened.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: A gun..? Why's that? Hey, Holly?! Your buddy here want a drink? They're FREE. Older Guy stops, surprised: This guy's plastered. Holly, somehow, looks less surprised.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER GUY
dialogues.text: Let's all just step this way, Mr. March.  123 He indicates an area behind the Port-a-Johns. Obscure. Em Screened by PALM TREES.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Hey, if you say so. It's a party, right?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY DOWNSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Trying to help Chet. Trying to talk to him at the same ti

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Chet, the film? Amelia's film? Where..? Chet's head slumps to one side, against Healy's arm. Givi him a close up view of Healy's watch... He smiles suddenl

dialogues.speaker: CHET
dialogues.text: Starts... now...

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: What..?

dialogues.speaker: CHET
dialogues.text: Spliced... in... Starts now... And right at that moment we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is still and quiet in here. THE CAMERA slowly closes in on the projector... As without warning -- CLICK! -- the system jumps to life. The whole thing, running off a TIMER. Chet or no Chet -- it's movie time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly all the lights dim. The search lights shut down. a blast of JAZZY, UP-TEMPO MUSIC fills the air. JOHN BOY goes rigid. Spins. Looking up--

dialogues.speaker: THE GIANT SCREEN STARTS TO GLOW
dialogues.text: Blossoms to life as, below, A THOUSAND HEADS turn as one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March, WOOZY. Leans on a chair back for support. Older Gu shoves HOLLY with the GUN --  124

dialogues.speaker: OLDER GUY
dialogues.text: Okay. This is far enou-- STOPS. Frowns. From below, MOVIE MUSIC. What in God's name..? He turns, distracted -- It's as good a chance as March is gonna get. MARCH'S FACE. Slack. Drunken. Miserable. And then, OUT OF NOWHERE, it transforms-- If you blinked, you missed it. Suddenly he ain't drunk. Suddenly he looks hard. And grim... And FURIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: (completely sober voice)

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY, DUCK
dialogues.text: Holly hits the floor as--

dialogues.speaker: MARCH SPINS, SLINGS THE CHAIR--
dialogues.text: OLDER GUY doesn't react quick enough. THE CHAIR SMASHES him in the face..! And March is still in motion. Spinning -- knife-edged HAN outstretched. CHOPS viciously at the guy's NECK. Once. TW Crushes his trachea, COLLAPSES it. The man stumbles in circles. Fingers go slack. The gun drops. March is on it, instantly -- OLDER GUY grabs HOLLY. An iron grip. Gurgling..! March FIRES, BLAM--! From the ground, no hesitation. Blows Older Guy BACK... Toward the looming EDGE. He teeters, starts to go over... Still clutching Holly.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH DOESN'T THINK
dialogues.text: LUNGES. Sheer desperation. With his good arm, miraculousl SLAPS HOLLY BACK onto the ROOF -- Sadly, accompanies Older Guy INTO THE SKY. THEY PLUMMET. Holly SCREAMS--! DOWN. DOWN. Two men. Tumbling... Getting smaller and smaller... Until

dialogues.speaker: TWO DISTINCT OUTCOMES
dialogues.text: March hits the POOL -- Older Guy, well... DOESN'T.  125 The result: March SPLASHES -- Older Guy sort of... well, POPS.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND LEVEL
dialogues.text: Men in tuxes, women in gowns: SPACKLED. Older Guy fucking exploded. A woman SCREAMS. BIKINI GIRLS flee the pool -- Amazingly, amid the thousand-odd folks, only a handful ev notice what happened... A RIPPLE, off to one side. JOHN BOY SEES IT. But doesn't seem all that interested. Calmly starts for the HOTEL; he's got to stop the FILM--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors burst open. HEALY EMERGES. Scanning the crowd. hand on the GUN in his pocket. Just in time, as, up above

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GIANT MOVIE SCREEN
dialogues.text: "Motor City Pride," is abruptly PRE-EMPTED. Clicks. Pops. A few feet of LEADER. And then --

dialogues.speaker: MISTY MOUNTAINS APPEARS, 30 FEET HIGH
dialogues.text: She looks great. Healy exhales a ragged breath. The film' rolling, the jig's up: HUNDREDS of people, gazing upward Now ANOTHER ACTOR appears on screen. We HEAR dialogue:

dialogues.speaker: MALE ACTOR
dialogues.text: I'm Bergen Paulsen! I represent the Detroit auto manufacturers!

dialogues.speaker: DOWN IN THE COURTYARD
dialogues.text: The real Bergen Paulsen watches. Thunderstruck:

dialogues.speaker: BERGEN PAULSEN
dialogues.text: Oh, my God...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN BOY
dialogues.text: Observes the switchover. He's too late. Okay, fine. Knows what he has to do. Turns, shoulders back through the crowd. Fishes in his co Approaches a poolside LAMBORGHINI, revolving on its pedes In passing, calmly rolls a HAND GRENADE underneath it. Ke walking. Produces an AUTOMATIC, never breaks stride.  126 Aiming up at the 9th floor. He targets the projector and OPENS FIRE. INSTANT PANDEMONIUM. People screaming. Scrabbling to get out of his way. He BLOWS A WHOLE CLIP skyward. No good. The film keeps right on playing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCH comes to, UNDERWATER. Panicked. THRASHES wildly. God, he's DROWNING--!

dialogues.speaker: OPENS HIS EYES, SEES RICHARD NIXON
dialogues.text: Swimming beside him. Waving... It barely registers... HE KICKS HIS LEGS-- We follow him up... up... out of the blue deep. He breaks the SURFACE. Clutches the CONCRETE. Choking, gasping -- A CAR BLOWS APART. Not twenty feet from him. The Lamborghini TEARS ITSELF TO BITS. Bystanders, killed. Ripped by shrapnel. Black oilsmoke FUNNELS SKYWARD. FULL SCALE CHAOS. A thousand people run for their lives. Our guys can kill a party like no one's business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At roof's edge, HOLLY drops flat. Shouts down:

dialogues.speaker: DAD..
dialogues.text: SMOKE billows upward. But she spots March... A tiny figure down there. On his KNEES. He waves up at he She lets out a breath. RELIEVED. Starts to turn away -- something catches her eye. THE FIL MISTY'S IMAGE starts to shake... Skips... Then, all at on THE SCREEN GOES DARK. Someone just stopped the movie.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.  127

dialogues.speaker: WITH MARCH
dialogues.text: Retrieving his fallen gun... He notices it too. Takes a few steps. Staring up... SOMEONE GRABS HIM. He start to recoil--! It's HEALY.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: The film. Let's go. Healy pulls him toward the hotel. March, fighting to KEEP UP. Huffing, wheezing. Two sorry-ass saviors, these. Healy turns to say something -- FREEZES. Focusing past MARCH'S SHOULDER. Eyes wide. JOHN BOY. THEY LOCK EYES.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH, ON YOUR NINE.
dialogues.text: Huh? March spins, whoops, that's his THREE -- HEALY doesn't blink. Cross-draws his gun and OPENS FIRE. Through the smoke. JOHN BOY dives, rolls --

dialogues.speaker: FIRES AT MARCH, BAM-BAM-BAM--
dialogues.text: Jesus! MARCH DIVES across a sports car... Lunges over the hood. Metal, pocked..! PERFORATED. He LANDS. Shaken. Hugs the vehicle. Safe, ALIVE. HEALY, RELENTLESS. PROWLS THE SMOKE. Gun up. Around him, flame. CARNAGE.

dialogues.speaker: WITH MARCH
dialogues.text: Here's the thing: With respect to HIM? The car is stock- still. Immobile, and thus good cover. One problem:

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR IS REVOLVING
dialogues.text: And so is MARCH, oblivious. Behind him, scenery keeps changing... He doesn't notice. Raises his gun. Takes a steadying breath. Behind him, JOHN BOY drifts into view... March, eyes clos

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Okay. You can do this. Ready? One. Tw-- BANG--! Blood LEAPS from his arm. March, SHOT.  128

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: WOOOOOWWW!! Fuck! Fuck! OW! He looks around. Confused. HEALY targets the muzzle flash. Lays COVER FIRE as MARCH attempts to dive back over the car, and meantime--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLY comes bursting through the door: TALLY is here. Nose broken. Looks like shit. THE FILM'S o the projector, she's got it in a canister. Using electric TAPE to SEAL it. Whirls round, SCISSORS in hand --

dialogues.speaker: AND HOLLY SLIPS
dialogues.text: On the COFFEE puddle from before. Goes down, SLIDING...

dialogues.speaker: IT SAVES HER LIFE
dialogues.text: As Tally HURLS the scissors, THWACK--! They STICK in the wall. Holly scrambles past her... Snatches the FILM CAN.

dialogues.speaker: TALLY
dialogues.text: Give me that, you fucked-up little

dialogues.speaker: HIPPIE
dialogues.text: Advances on Holly. Murderous... With nowhere to run, Holl looks Tally right in the eye, says:

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Lady, you want it..? (smiles) Go get it. With that, she turns, and rolls the can straight for the balcony RAILING. Tally FREAKS. Lunges after it -- Holly TRIPS HER. Down she goes. She SCREAMS. Leading with her face, WHACK! Into the railing. She's done. Holly then watches, mesmerized... As the future of Detroit ROLLS OFF THE EDGE. Into space.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN BELOW
dialogues.text: Everyone looks up, following the sound of Tally's scream.

dialogues.speaker: THE OBJECT OF THEIR QUEST
dialogues.text: Arcing through the night.  129 JOHN BOY, frozen. Tracking its descent... MARCH, crouched behind a car, watching... HEALY, transfixed... CEO BERGEN PAULSEN, HIS BODYGUARDS... all RAPT. It catches the moonlight like a shiny COIN. VANISHES into the billowing SMOKE... Spell, broken:

dialogues.speaker: PAULSEN
dialogues.text: (to bodyguards) Get me that film. And just that quickly, it's a whole new ballgame. Basically? Everyone makes a run for the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a split second, everyone's up and running. March STAGGERS, nearly goes down. Beaten, bedraggled. DEA He should lie down. Instead? For no visible reason, he GALVANIZES. Suddenly he's RUNNING. HEALY appears at his side. They pour it on. Leaping obstacles. Dodging flaming wreckage -- JOHN BOY materializes. Ten yards to their right. Healy SHOUTS:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: March! Get the film! Then PEELS OFF towards John Boy. FLINGS himself at the gu They go crashing through tables and furniture. Locked in combat. And meanwhile--

dialogues.speaker: MARCH, STILL RUNNING
