dialogues.text: Up ahead, Bergen Paulsen's BODYGUARDS, sprinting for the film... March is closer. He swoops in at a dead run. Snatches up the film -- KEEPS GOING. Just clutches it to his chest and fucking RUNS. BODYGUARDS, pounding after him. He swerves, toward the HO LOBBY. Feet slapping. Breath, sawing in and out.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: NowayfuckyoufuckYOUNOWAYFUCKYOU.  130 A BULLET cuts the air like an angry hornet. Hits the GLASS entryway -- COLLAPSES IT. As March LEAPS. Sails through the shattered doors... Lands. Tumbles, HARD -- rolls to his feet, KEEPS GOING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN BOY's got HEALY. He SPINS him -- SLAMS him down onto GLASS BAR. Shatters it with Healy's FACE. Healy, in trouble. SCRABBLES BEHIND HIM with both arms. Flails at John Boy's Actually jams a hand in his COAT POCKET. Yanks, tugs -- Breaks FREE. SPINS back around. Arms up -- STOPS. Noticing something. Something in his hand. It's a GRENADE PIN. He just yanked it from John Boy's pocket. He stares at it dumbly. John Boy looks, too. Oh, Shit. Healy turns and RUNS. John Boy paws at his coat. Frantic. UP. Whips it off and FLINGS IT.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT BECOMES DAY
dialogues.text: A shattering ROAR. The floor tilts sideways. DEBRIS, showering. Bits of flaming wood--! JOHN BOY, ROCKED. Blown off his feet. Flung, head over heels -- HEALY, blown sideways. Rolls to his feet. ON FIRE. Hurls himself at JOHN BOY, no hesitation, and meanwhile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCH bursts forth into the REAR PARKING LOT. Running for his life. Running to SAVE THE FILM. Paulsen's BODYGUARDS, on his tail... Gunshot, a brittle CRACK--! Parts his hair. He jukes left. Out into the STREET and

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: 131 Doing maybe 25 miles an hour. Not too fast, but fast enou Pops him up onto the hood. He SMACKS the windshield. LOSES THE FILM. It slips out of his hands. Starts ROLLING. Away from him. Down the street... The driver gets out, PISSED OFF:

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: What the fuck you think you're doing?! That's L.A. for you. MARCH, dazed, ignores him. Or maybe he doesn't even hear Struggles to his feet. Film, GONE. He dropped it. Where--? There. ROLLING. March is gonna have to CATCH it

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HIM, OUT OF FOCUS
dialogues.text: The BODYGUARDS appear. Shove past the irate DRIVER. Knock on his ass... He starts yelling. An altercation ensues --

dialogues.speaker: MARCH, OBLIVIOUS
dialogues.text: Breaks into an awkward, hitching jog... As, behind him, amazingly -- a FULL BLOWN FIGHT ensues. The driver SCREAM Then someone FIRES A GUN back there. BLAM--! March doesn't care. Keeps on. Like a kid chasing after a Five feet in front of him... Three feet... MORE GUNFIRE now. The driver firing at the bodyguards. Th firing back. Who knows..? March reaches out. One FINGER.. Touches the canister. STOPS it. It wobbles once. Becomes still... He snatches it up. His prize. And promptly collapses. Right in the middle of the road. Falls down. Sits clutchi the film. Looking around, addled. Woozy. Breath sawing. There are bodies over there. Flashing lights, too. People moving. The POLICE... March frowns, when did they get her He didn't notice. He's got the film. And meanwhile:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLY appears now. Following a trail of destruction. Running, head throbbing. Rounds the side of the hotel --  132 And there's HEALY. At his feet, flat on the cement: JOHN BOY. Healy's got him in a headlock. Meaty forearm, encircling the guy's big bull neck-- He's CHOKING him to death.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Holly, get back! Go away! Holly remains. Panting. Fixed on Healy:

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! Stop! Healy stop! Healy doesn't let up. John Boy turning purple in his arms

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Please! You don't have to kill him!

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Yes, I do, Holly! Get away! Now! She refuses to budge. Stares Healy down:

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: You don't! You didn't kill that blue- faced guy... You didn't kill him. Healy's caught off-guard. Suddenly aware of the lie he to

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Holly... He killed Amelia... He's a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: But you're not. Leave him for the police. Healy, conflicted. The teenager watching him choke a man to death.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Mr. Healy, if you kill this man, I'll never speak to you again. Healy stares up at Holly. A long moment... John Boy dying every second of it. Finally, Healy sighs... cautiously disengages himself. As he rolls to one knee, we see that he's HURT. Bleeding. He looms over the fallen John Boy:  133

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Congratulations... You owe your life to a sixteen year-old girl. John Boy locks eyes with Holly... Says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: (raises his arm--) Goodnight, John Boy. On the blow to the HEAD we CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY MOUNTAINS
dialogues.text: Big as life. Wearing a BLUE PIN-STRIPED SUIT. She sits at desk, writing. The nameplate on her desk says JUDITH KUTT We hear a KNOCKING off screen. She looks up:

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens. And a CHEESY LOOKING GUY steps through. He fixes Misty with a stare, then starts to WILDLY OVERACT:

dialogues.speaker: CHEESY GUY
dialogues.text: I'm Bergen Paulsen! I represent the Detroit auto manufacturers! What's this about you suing us?! Misty stands up, strikes a sexy pose:

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: You poisoned our precious air! The people won't stand for it! Cheesy Guy approaches Misty, tries out his own sexy stanc

dialogues.speaker: CHEESY GUY
dialogues.text: What if we could come to some kind of arrangement, Mrs. Kuttner..? A monetary arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: »-. I don't know... I'd need to know the exact amounts you'd pay me -- along with the dates and times of payment.  134

dialogues.speaker: CHEESY GUY
dialogues.text: That's no problem... Take off your clothes and we'll talk about it. Misty hesitates for a second, then starts to disrobe as a FUNKY GUITAR RIFF kicks in. And now the CAMERA starts to pull back, revealing the edg of a MOVIE SCREEN. Back further now-- We're inside a courtroom. A closed door, grand jury heari Jurors watch the projected film with mounting discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March and Healy sit on a bench in the hallway. March star the ground. Healy gazes at the ceiling. They're silent. A door opens down the hall, and the real JUDITH KUTTNER emerges. Flanked by two UNIFORMED OFFICERS. They sit her down on a bench directly opposite our guys. Handcuff her to it. Move off a few paces to stand guard. An awkward silence... Kuttner breaks it.

dialogues.speaker: KUTTNER
dialogues.text: I guess you two think you've done something here. Pause, then:

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: This ain't about what we've done. It's about what you did.

dialogues.speaker: KUTTNER
dialogues.text: Do you even... have a clue as to what just happened?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: More than a clue.

dialogues.speaker: KUTTNER
dialogues.text: I stepped out of line..? That it? Took money for personal gain..? They say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: KUTTNER
dialogues.text: I didn't want that money. It wasn't some "plan" I had. Do you get that? There's a protocol. I followed it.  135

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: What does that even mean?

dialogues.speaker: KUTTNER
dialogues.text: You think you're gonna bring down the car companies? Start a revolution? What age are you two living in? (beat) Detroit can't be allowed to fail. It's as simple as that... They'd take the whole country down with them. (shakes her head) I was acting in the national interest.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: And your daughter? What about her interests?

dialogues.speaker: KUTTNER
dialogues.text: (blinks) «+. I tried to save her.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: You had her killed.

dialogues.speaker: KUTTNER
dialogues.text: (flash of anger) I did no such thing! Detroit had her killed! I wanted her safe -- why do you think I hired you? (beat, calm again) I tried to save her from herself. Her composure, restored. It's downright creepy.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: You're going to jail, Mrs. Kuttner. Where you belong. A pause. She regards both of them for a moment, then says

dialogues.speaker: KUTTNER
dialogues.text: I am going to jail... But it won't make a difference. (beat) Whatever happens, Detroit won't be held accountable. If I'm not there to take care of it, so someone else will.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Yeah..? We'll see.

dialogues.speaker: KUTTNER
dialogues.text: Yes. You will, Mr. March.  136 She leans back as the courtroom doors burst open, people start to file out. A lawyer walks past March and Healy:

dialogues.speaker: LAWYER
dialogues.text: We're getting you in, right after lunch. He gives them the thumbs up, walks on past. March and Healy stare across at Kuttner... Lost in though

dialogues.speaker: A RINGING BELL
dialogues.text: WIDER - It's a CHRISTMAS BELL. Guy in a SANTA COSTUME sta a street corner ringing it... Apparently it's Christmasti A CAR pulls up next to Santa. Healy gets out. Starts down sidewalk. In a bit of a hurry. Ducks into a restaurant--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hostess approaches Healy, he waves her off. Spots HOLLY sitting by herself at a table. Walks over to

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Where do you think? He's at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: I guess he heard.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Oh, boy, did he ever. (beat) See if you can do something with him, ‘cuz I sure can't.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: I'll try...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCH, folded across the bar like a man clutching a life Soused... Healy appears, takes the seat next to him.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Healy..? What are you-- (squints) Holly call you..? Healy just nods.  137

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Ah... Guess you're here to tell me what an asshole I am for having a little drink, huh?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Not today I'm not. He signals the bartender.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Scotch, please. March regards his friend with drunken incredulity...

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: ... So, you saw it, on the TV-- March points at the black and white suspended behind the

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: I saw.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: They're lettin 'em off... The car companies... Scott free... (shakes his head) Not enough evidence... So they say...

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: I saw. The bartender sets a drink in front of Healy. His first drink in five years. He looks down at it, considering...

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Look... Maybe they got away with it this time... Thing is, people are stupid, but they aren't that stupid--

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: If you say so...

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: I say so... These guys are going down. In ten years, we're all gonna be driving electric cars from Japan. So fuck ‘em, you know? March thinks for a moment... Slowly starts to nod.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Yeah... Fuck ‘em.  138 Healy raises his drink in a toast. March follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: For the birds.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH
dialogues.text: Hallelujah. They drink. March looks down. Sees a BEE crawling on the bar. He takes a napkin. MASHES it. CUT TO BLACK. THE END.
